emails.subject: AeroDelft Paris Air Show
emails.body:
Dear Bas,

I wanted to reach out because we are currently looking for options to
attend the Paris Air Show. We noticed that KLM E&M is attending, and
thought it could be a great opportunity to share our collaboration with the
industry if we could attend with KLM. If possible, we could even bring our
stand; however, if I understand correctly, stand space is in short supply.

Please let me know what you think, I'm always available to call.

Best regards,
Emil
-- 

Emil Wes Lambert

Business Manager AeroDelft

E: emil.lambert@aerodelft.nl

T: â­+31 06 21 67 53 16

W: www.aerodelft.nl

L: *www.linkedin.com/in/emil
<http://www.linkedin.com/in/emil-wes-lambert-5308bb173>wl/*

emails.subject: AeroDelft Sponsorship / Update
emails.body:
Dear Harco,

I wanted to reach out, we just sent the second invoice for the partnership
but I realise it was an informal agreement to receive 30k EUR as opposed to
the 20k agreed in the contract.

I wanted to reach out to at least ask if we could have this arrangement
again this year, it would be much appreciated.

Secondly I wanted to ask for you to let me know the next time you are
around / want to come to Delft. We met briefly in Kiruna this winter break
and felt it would be great to have a coffee or beer to hear your updates as
well as share ours. We have some exciting ones!

Best wishes,
-- 

Emil Wes Lambert

Business Manager AeroDelft

E: emil.lambert@aerodelft.nl

emails.subject: AeroDelft Intership Platform / General Collaboration
emails.body:
Dear Daniel,

We met last year at the AeroDelft Lustrum, I was supposed to reach out for
the internship platform. This is still mostly word of mouth and is due for
a real structure, but I've had to sideline it for a while. I want to work
on it over the summer when I have some time.

The other reason I want to reach out is to see what potential
collaboration there is. We often get referred to contact DLR when looking
for external advice and I think it is certainly beneficial for AeroDelft to
be able to expand the current network. Likewise, I feel DLR stands to gain
from this arrangement as well.

Best regards,
-- 

Emil Wes Lambert

Business Manager AeroDelft

E: emil.lambert@aerodelft.nl

T: â­+31 06 21 67 53 16

W: www.aerodelft.nl

L: *www.linkedin.com/in/emil

emails.subject: AeroDelft Onboarding
emails.body:
Hey Wouter,

Sorry for my shit communication. It's been very hectic. I want to schedule
some time to onboard you and go through our current affairs properly. The
first thing that we will need to work on is the motor situation I talked
about. Before that it would be great to get you up to scratch with the
legal side of things.

I've attached the legal bible (i wrote it quickly so its not the best but
does give a good overview). On the drive
<https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1UOmeCYiJXqExS7HbAzumV7UNlq95eZvG?usp=sharing>
there
is also the contracts, if you could look at the templates it shows the NDAs
and partnership agreements. For Saluqi
<https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1xPlprvvl7SrMnzDVBGZI9X2RNV4WA2Ij?usp=drive_link>
(the motor company) there is this which I made at the start of the year,
not much has changed apart from more of the same. We have found a suitable
alternative so now is time to figure out what we want and how to handle it
with saluqi.

We should schedule a morning or afternoon to go through this all, if you
could fill out your availability
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1C-Pw8J8DpLT7NW4cLwNqhT3jZTodYcPKxyUct7MYjew/edit?usp=sharing>
for the month, I will give a call so we can schedule in the time. I'm
flexible with the in person time, but it would be nice for you to be there
for a day or two at the beginning to meet some people here. I also sent a
link to meet the old team on the whatsapp.

Best regards,
-- 

Emil Wes Lambert

Business Manager AeroDelft

E: emil.lambert@aerodelft.nl

T: â­+31 06 21 67 53 16

W: www.aerodelft.nl

L: *www.linkedin.com/in/emil

emails.body:

It was nice to meet you today, I liked your responses. We cannot send an
application decision till April 12, this is in place so the student teams
do not poach anyone from each other.

On another note, I am curious about what your availability would look like

exams.

emails.subject: AeroDelft Intership Platform / General Collaboration
emails.body:
Dear Daniel,

We met last year at the AeroDelft Lustrum, I was supposed to reach out for
the internship platform. This is still mostly word of mouth and is due for
a real structure, but I've had to sideline it for a while. I want to work
on it over the summer when I have some time.

collaboration there is. We often get referred to contact DLR when looking
for external advice and I think it is certainly beneficial for AeroDelft to
be able to expand the current network. Likewise, I feel DLR stands to gain
from this arrangement as well.

emails.subject: AeroDelft Onboarding
emails.body:
Hey Wouter,

Sorry for my shit communication. It's been very hectic. I want to schedule
some time to onboard you and go through our current affairs properly. The
first thing that we will need to work on is the motor situation I talked
about. Before that it would be great to get you up to scratch with the
legal side of things.

I've attached the legal bible (i wrote it quickly so its not the best but
does give a good overview). On the drive
<https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1UOmeCYiJXqExS7HbAzumV7UNlq95eZvG?usp=sharing>
there
is also the contracts, if you could look at the templates it shows the NDAs
and partnership agreements. For Saluqi
<https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1xPlprvvl7SrMnzDVBGZI9X2RNV4WA2Ij?usp=drive_link>
(the motor company) there is this which I made at the start of the year,
not much has changed apart from more of the same. We have found a suitable
alternative so now is time to figure out what we want and how to handle it
with saluqi.

We should schedule a morning or afternoon to go through this all, if you
could fill out your availability
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1C-Pw8J8DpLT7NW4cLwNqhT3jZTodYcPKxyUct7MYjew/edit?usp=sharing>
for the month, I will give a call so we can schedule in the time. I'm
flexible with the in person time, but it would be nice for you to be there

emails.subject: AeroDelft Intership Platform / General Collaboration
emails.body:
Dear Daniel,

We met last year at the AeroDelft Lustrum, I was supposed to reach out for
the internship platform. This is still mostly word of mouth and is due for
a real structure, but I've had to sideline it for a while. I want to work
on it over the summer when I have some time.

The other reason I want to reach out is to see what potential
collaboration there is. We often get referred to contact DLR when looking
for external advice and I think it is certainly beneficial for AeroDelft to
be able to expand the current network. Likewise, I feel DLR stands to gain
from this arrangement as well.

Best regards,

emails.subject: AeroDelft Sponsorship / Update
emails.body:
Dear Harco,

I wanted to reach out, we just sent the second invoice for the partnership
but I realise it was an informal agreement to receive 30k EUR as opposed to
the 20k agreed in the contract.

I wanted to reach out to at least ask if we could have this arrangement
again this year, it would be much appreciated.

Secondly I wanted to ask for you to let me know the next time you are
around / want to come to Delft. We met briefly in Kiruna this winter break
and felt it would be great to have a coffee or beer to hear your updates as
well as share ours. We have some exciting ones!

emails.subject: AeroDelft Intership Platform / General Collaboration
emails.body:
Dear Daniel,

We met last year at the AeroDelft Lustrum, I was supposed to reach out for
the internship platform. This is still mostly word of mouth and is due for
a real structure, but I've had to sideline it for a while. I want to work
on it over the summer when I have some time.

The other reason I want to reach out is to see what potential
collaboration there is. We often get referred to contact DLR when looking
for external advice and I think it is certainly beneficial for AeroDelft to
be able to expand the current network. Likewise, I feel DLR stands to gain
from this arrangement as well.

Best regards,
--

emails.subject: AeroDelft Onboarding
emails.body:
Hey Wouter,

Sorry for my shit communication. It's been very hectic. I want to schedule
some time to onboard you and go through our current affairs properly. The
first thing that we will need to work on is the motor situation I talked
about. Before that it would be great to get you up to scratch with the
legal side of things.

I've attached the legal bible (i wrote it quickly so its not the best but
does give a good overview). On the drive
<https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1UOmeCYiJXqExS7HbAzumV7UNlq95eZvG?usp=sharing>
there
is also the contracts, if you could look at the templates it shows the NDAs
and partnership agreements. For Saluqi
<https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1xPlprvvl7SrMnzDVBGZI9X2RNV4WA2Ij?usp=drive_link>
(the motor company) there is this which I made at the start of the year,
not much has changed apart from more of the same. We have found a suitable
alternative so now is time to figure out what we want and how to handle it
with saluqi.

We should schedule a morning or afternoon to go through this all, if you
could fill out your availability
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1C-Pw8J8DpLT7NW4cLwNqhT3jZTodYcPKxyUct7MYjew/edit?usp=sharing>
for the month, I will give a call so we can schedule in the time. I'm
flexible with the in person time, but it would be nice for you to be there
for a day or two at the beginning to meet some people here. I also sent a
link to meet the old team on the whatsapp.

Best regards,
-- 

Emil Wes Lambert
